This Is Helix. Powered by You.
At
BMC Helix
, we don’t do ordinary. We’re the
AI-native engine
behind the world’s most forward-thinking IT organizations, helping them focus on what matters most. What are we passionate about? We're here to reset the economics of enterprise IT and help others realize the ROI of AI.
We are a mix of
curious minds, creative thinkers, and courageous builders
who believe tech should change the game—not just play it. We celebrate wins, support each other, and laugh a lot.
We are the change makers. With decades of leadership and established trust in IT service and operations management, we’re scaling with purpose—through organic innovation, strategic acquisitions, and relentless R&D. Our open-first
Agentic AI platform
empowers autonomous agents to drive real outcomes with speed, accountability, and precision.
We are laser-focused on delivering real value to our customers by accelerating innovation and the application of applying agentic AI in digital service and operations management for IT organizations around the world.
BMC Software Sales Professionals have the power to transform entire organizations. With your high-energy, dedication, and passion you will focus on designing and executing a go-to-market strategy, delivering revenue growth and customer happiness. If you are looking for a company that gives you the freedom to expand your role, focuses highly on your professional development through continuous enablement, gives you an environment where you would feel happy to come to work, then BMC is the place to be.
Join us as a Sales Account Manager!  As a Sales Account Manager, you will own a territory where you will be positioning BMC’s Iconic and cutting-edge technologies into some of the most prestigious customers.
Here is how, through this exciting role, you will contribute to BMC's and your own success:
• Act as the main point of contact for your customers. Throughout the full sales cycle, you will be supported by top, talented, product specialized Account Managers, Solution & Value Engineers, as well as a full ecosystem dedicated to BMC’s main strategy: customer centricity.
• Be the business owner of your territory to increase our footprint, build larger deals, and help BMC remain in its well-deserved market leader position.
• Lead as a BMC brand ambassador, both internally and externally, and build trust and confidence with customers, partners, and colleagues through integrity and professionalism.
• As every BMC employee, you will be given the opportunity to learn, be included in global projects, challenge yourself, and be the innovator when it comes to solving everyday problems.
To ensure you’re set up for success, you will bring the following skillset & experience:
• You can embrace, live and breathe our BMC values every day!
• You will have worked effectively as a team member while also providing team-on-team leadership and orchestrating the internal and external resources needed to effectively manage the sales process
• You have previously demonstrated your ability to further develop your business as a trusted partner by an in-depth understanding of pipeline, business practices, industry trends, and competitive landscape.

About the Role – Account Manager (South India)
Join us as an Account Manager - India
you will own a territory where you will be positioning BMC helix's Iconic and cutting-edge technologies into some of the most prestigious customers. Y
ou will be responsible for driving BMC Helix’s growth across
large enterprises in South India
, including
Manufacturing, Pharmaceuticals, IT/ITeS, Global Capability Centers (GCCs), BFSI, and large diversified enterprises
.
You will own strategic enterprise accounts, manage complex buying groups, and drive large, multi-year software deals by positioning BMC Helix as a trusted transformation partner for CIO, CTO, CISO, and Digital leaders.
This role requires strong enterprise sales experience, deep understanding of IT operations and digital transformation priorities, and the ability to manage long, consultative sales cycles in large, matrixed organizations.
Here is how, through this exciting role, you will contribute to BMC's and your own success:
Territory & Account Ownership
Own end-to-end responsibility for assigned enterprise accounts      across South India, including
account strategy, pipeline creation,      forecasting, and revenue delivery
.
Develop
annual territory plans and detailed account plans
for      large enterprises—mapping stakeholders, identifying strategic initiatives,      understanding IT and business priorities, and defining growth plans.
Drive deeper penetration within accounts by expanding BMC Helix      adoption across
ITSM, ITOM, AIOps, Automation, Observability, and      Security Operations
portfolios.
Enterprise Customer Engagement
Serve as the primary relationship owner for strategic enterprise      customers, working closely with
Solution Engineering, Value      Engineering, Customer Success, Renewals, Legal, and Product teams
.
Build strong multi-level relationships across
CXO, IT leadership,      operations, security, and procurement teams
.
Lead executive conversations focused on
business outcomes, ROI,      resilience, operational efficiency, and digital transformation
.
Position BMC Helix as a long-term strategic partner rather than a      point solution vendor.
Solution Positioning & Value Selling
Deliver high-impact product presentations, executive briefings, and      whiteboarding sessions tailored to enterprise use cases.
Translate complex technical capabilities into
clear business      value propositions
aligned to enterprise priorities.
Support customers through evaluation, proof-of-value, and      decision-making processes.
Partner with Value Engineering to build compelling
business cases      and ROI models
.
Deal Strategy & Execution
Build and maintain a robust enterprise pipeline using structured      qualification frameworks such as
MEDDIC / MEDDPICC
.
Own deal strategy from discovery through closure, including pricing,      commercial structuring, negotiations, and approvals.
Navigate complex enterprise procurement processes, legal reviews,      and multi-stakeholder approvals.
Ensure accurate forecasting, CRM hygiene, and disciplined pipeline      management.
Partner & Ecosystem Collaboration
Work closely with
system integrators, global consulting firms,      and regional partners
to drive joint enterprise opportunities.
Influence partner-led deals by ensuring strong positioning,      competitive differentiation, and execution discipline.
Collaborate with marketing on enterprise events, CXO roundtables,      and demand-generation initiatives in the region.
Cross-Functional Leadership
Act as the voice of the customer internally, providing insights to      Product Management, Leadership, and Global Teams.
Collaborate with global BMC Helix teams to leverage best practices,      customer success stories, and product roadmaps.
To ensure you’re set up for success, you will bring the following skillset & experience:
Experience & Background
10–12+ years of experience
in enterprise software sales,      managing large, complex accounts in South India.
Proven track record of consistently achieving or exceeding sales      targets in
large enterprise environments
.
Experience selling enterprise platforms such as
ITSM, ITOM,      AIOps, Automation, Cloud, Observability, or Infrastructure Management
.
Enterprise Sales Expertise
Strong understanding of
enterprise buying processes
, long      sales cycles, and multi-stakeholder decision-making.
Experience engaging with
CIO, CTO, CISO, Head of IT Operations,      and Digital Transformation leaders
.
Ability to manage large deal values, multi-year contracts, and      strategic renewals.
Sales Execution & Discipline
Expertise in
account planning, pipeline management, forecasting,      and QBRs
.
Proficiency with
SFDC or equivalent CRM tools
.
Strong negotiation, pricing, and commercial structuring skills.
Relationship & Influence
Established relationships within large enterprises across      Manufacturing, Pharma, IT/ITeS, GCCs, and BFSI in South India.
Ability to influence technical, operational, commercial, and      executive stakeholders.
Strong collaboration skills with partners, internal teams, and      leadership.
Personal Attributes
High ownership mindset with strong customer focus.
Excellent communication skills and executive presence.
Strategic, consultative, and value-led selling approach.
Self-driven, coachable, and comfortable working in a fast-paced,      matrixed organization.

. You will drive strategic sales, manage complex procurement cycles, and position BMC Helix’s industry-leading solutions to support large-scale digital transformation initiatives across the Government ecosystem.

Here is how, through this exciting role, you will contribute to BMC's and your own success:
Territory & Account Ownership
Own end-to-end responsibility for your Public Sector      territory—including sales strategy, execution, pipeline creation,      forecasting, and revenue delivery.
Build annual
Business Plans
and detailed
Account Plans
for key Ministries, Departments, PSUs, Defense units, and Banks, outlining      vision, stakeholders, use cases, risk mitigation, and growth initiatives.
Drive deep penetration into assigned accounts, increasing footprint      across ITSM, ITOM, AIOps, Agentic AI, Automation, and Security Operations      portfolios.
Customer Engagement & Solution Positioning
Act as the primary point of contact for all strategic engagements,      supported by Solution Engineering, Value Engineering, Customer Success,      Renewals, Legal, Product Management, R&D, and Sales Operations teams.
Establish strong relationships across operational, technical, and      CXO levels in Government and PSU organizations.
Deliver first-level product presentations, articulate value      propositions, and conduct whiteboarding sessions to demonstrate how BMC      Helix solves mission-critical public sector challenges.
Become a trusted advisor—guiding customers through transformation      initiatives, optimization opportunities, and ROI realization.

GeM
,
QCBS
,
L1
,
RA
, two-stage RFPs, EOI, tenders,      empanelment's, and multi-year rate contracts.

Coordinate closely with partner ecosystem (OEM partners, SI      partners, NIC, state agencies) to influence RFP design and shape demand.

Build and maintain a healthy pipeline; conduct rigorous      qualification using
MEDDIC, BANT
, and other recognized frameworks.
Own commercial proposal development, pricing structures, partner      alignment, and negotiation strategy.
Lead all major opportunities from discovery to closure ensuring best      practices, value maximization, and documentation integrity.
Drive customer escalations to resolution by effectively leveraging      internal teams.

Work with global teams across regions to tap into expertise, product      roadmaps, and technical support.
Represent customer needs and opportunities to internal stakeholders      including Product Management and Leadership.

Industry & Domain Expertise
10–12 years of experience
managing Government / PSU /      Defense / BFSI public sector accounts with consistent overachievement of      sales quotas.
Strong understanding of:
Central Ministries (MeitY, MoD,       MHA, MoF, Railways, Power etc.)
State Departments, SDC, SWAN,       NIC, State PSUs
Public Sector Banks &       Insurance
Maharatna, Navratna &       Miniratna PSUs
Defense and strategic sector       procurement cycles

ITSM,      ITOM, AIOps, Automation, Cloud, Observability, or Infrastructure      Management
.

Strong experience in building Business Plans, Account Plans,      pipeline strategies, QBRs, and executive stakeholder mapping.
Proficiency in SFDC (or equivalent CRM), pipeline hygiene, and      data-driven sales forecasting.
Demonstrated excellence in negotiations, commercial structuring,      pricing models, and partner-led deal execution.

Established relationships at CXO and senior leadership levels across      Central Ministries, State Departments, PSUs, Public Sector Banks, and      Defense organizations.
Proven ability to influence and engage multi-tier stakeholders —      operational, technical, commercial, and executive — to build long-term      trust and drive strategic account roadmaps.

Sales Best Practices Manager
BMC Helix is seeking a Sales Best Practices Manager for the Americas to join a highly trusted and influential team that partners directly with field leadership on BMC Helix’s most complex, high value, and strategically important transactions. The Best Practices organization serves as a center of excellence for deal strategy, negotiation, and agreement structure, ensuring BMC Helix optimizes customer outcomes while protecting long term business value.
This role requires strong executive presence, advanced negotiation and financial acumen, and the ability to influence outcomes across a highly matrixed organization. Best Practices Managers are deeply embedded in the sales process, exposed to senior leadership, and actively shape how BMC Helix executes and governs large, non-standard, and highly visible deals.
Here is how, through this exciting role, YOU will contribute to BMC's and your own success:
Act as a trusted advisor to sales leadership and account teams on complex commercial strategy, negotiation approach, and deal structure across strategic and high-risk opportunities
Lead and coordinate cross functional stakeholders including Sales, Legal, Finance, Accounting, Customer Success, Order Services, Compliance, and Product to develop commercially sound, executable customer agreements
Directly engage with customers, when appropriate, to support negotiations, resolve complex commercial issues, and expand the zone of possible agreement
Partner with management and field leadership to develop strategies that balance short term revenue objectives with long term business sustainability
Drive consistency, rigor, and best practices in deal execution, while enabling deal velocity and mitigating downstream booking, revenue recognition, and compliance risk
Identify systemic issues, commercial trends, and opportunities for improvement across the sales process and provide actionable recommendations to senior leadership
Serve as a subject matter expert for negotiation, commercial structuring, and value based selling, partnering with enablement to deliver targeted training and guidance
Build and maintain deep, value add relationships across all internal organizations that influence or execute customer agreements
To ensure you’re set up for success, you will bring the following skillset & experience:
Exceptional communication and executive level facilitation skills, with the ability to drive alignment and decision making
Advanced problem-solving capabilities, including strong pattern recognition and the ability to simplify complex commercial and contractual issues
Minimum of ten years of direct sales or equivalent deal leadership experience in enterprise or strategic accounts
Deep expertise in contracts, pricing, discounting, and selling strategies, with a demonstrated ability to negotiate complex, non standard agreements
Proven experience leading and managing high stakes customer situations and negotiations involving multiple internal and external stakeholders
Strong financial acumen, including the ability to evaluate deal economics, trade offs, and long term value implications
Highly organized, disciplined, and comfortable operating across multiple concurrent, high priority initiatives

BMC empowers nearly 80% of the Forbes Global 100 to accelerate business value, faster than humanly possible. Our industry-leading portfolio unlocks human and machine potential to drive business growth, innovation, and sustainable success. BMC does this in a simple and optimized way by connecting people, systems, and data that power the world’s largest organizations so they can seize a competitive advantage.
Our IS&T (Information Services and Technology) department provides all the required technology and operational support services to run our business here in BMC! We have over 200 servers on premises to support production, disaster recovery, databases, applications and over 1000 servers in Lab environment. IS&T is transformational not only for BMC but also for the customer experience, because we give a 360 degrees view to the customer about the products they should know, opportunities in the pipeline, and any service issues outstanding with the customer. We use cutting-edge technologies to manage BMC's infrastructure and showcase it to the customers – program is called BMC on BMC!
BMC is looking for a Lead Business Analyst to join our amazing global IS&T team.
In this role, you will play a pivotal role in optimizing our business processes and systems, by collecting requirements from stakeholders and translating them to actionable system solutions. You will be a part of a collaborative global team, while leveraging technology to drive processes and systems efficiency.
Here is how, through this exciting role, YOU will contribute to BMC's and your own success:
•	Facilitate requirements gathering sessions, workshops, and interviews with stakeholders to elicit and document business requirements, priorities, and constraints.
•	Translate requirements and business objectives into actionable system solutions.
